docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear a new challenge to President Barack Obama's healthcare law that took aim at a bureaucratic board labeled by some Republicans as a "death panel" because it was designed to cut Medicare costs.

headline.main: U.S. Supreme Court Rejects Obamacare 'Death Panel' Challenge
headline.print_headline: U.S. Supreme Court Rejects Obamacare 'Death Panel' Challenge

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear a new challenge to President Barack Obama's healthcare law that took aim at a bureaucratic board labeled by some Republicans as a "death panel" because it was designed to cut Medicare costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several Republican governors likely to run for president have secured hundreds millions of dollars under Obamacare while working to dismantle the healthcare law, according to a Reuters review of federal spending records.

headline.main: Exclusive: Republican White House Hopefuls Attack Obamacare but Take Money
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Republican White House Hopefuls Attack Obamacare but Take Money

docs.snippet: Several Republican governors likely to run for president have secured hundreds millions of dollars under Obamacare while working to dismantle the healthcare law, according to a Reuters review of federal spending records.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lufthansa's boss declined to answer a barrage of questions on Wednesday on what the airline knew of the mental health problems of Andreas Lubitz, the pilot believed to have deliberately crashed a plane in the French Alps last week.

headline.main: Lufthansa CEO Ignores Barrage of Questions on Pilot's Depression
headline.print_headline: Lufthansa CEO Ignores Barrage of Questions on Pilot's Depression

docs.lead_paragraph: Protected from democratic accountability, the government developed into a Rube Goldberg contraption that has a weak claim to a defensible social purpose.

headline.main: The False Hope of a Limited Government, Built on Tax Breaks
headline.print_headline: Tax Breaks Conceal Gears of Government

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column examines decades-old system of tax breaks, including those for employer-provided insurance, mortgages and charity, arguing it hides function of government and shields it from public debate; observes credits are justified as alternatives to expansion of government but argues instead that system amounts to Rube Goldberg contraption excluding many in middle and working classes, with little valid claim to social purpose.
docs.snippet: Protected from democratic accountability, the government developed into a Rube Goldberg contraption that has a weak claim to a defensible social purpose.
